column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////When my dining companions not-so-guiltily ordered a gilded dinner (that means they ordered a triple-digit seafood tower)
column2: I almost capitulated to peer pressure and ordered Bavette's signature bone-in ribeye
column3: almost violating my rule above. A cooler head prevailed
column4: and I stuck with the steak frites for a much more optimal price. I'm glad I did. Bavette's is a 7 oz skirt
column5: and in combination with a hearty spread of apps and sides
column6: it's plenty. Plenty delicious. For me
column7: it's a tossup between that and Topolobampo's mole carne asada for best piece of Chicago beef that's partied in my mouth. I can't recommend it enough.
